subject: AI
title: AI Regulation Landscape
description: A snapshot of how governments are approaching AI rules.

hook.text: The EU passed the AI Act, China requires algorithm registration, and the US is still debating. You build one product â€” which rules apply?

buildup.text: The EU AI Act classifies systems by risk: unacceptable (banned), high (strict rules), limited (transparency needed), minimal (mostly free). It's the most comprehensive framework so far.

discovery.text: China requires companies to register recommendation algorithms and disclose how they work. The US has sector-specific guidelines but no single federal AI law yet.

twist.text: Regulation moves slower than technology. By the time a law passes, the AI landscape may have shifted. Companies that self-regulate early often adapt faster when rules arrive.

climax.text: Know where your users are and which regulations apply. Build compliance into your process now â€” retrofitting is always more expensive.

punchline.text: The rules are coming. The smart move is to be ahead of them, not surprised by them.

quiz.question: How does the EU AI Act classify AI systems?
options: By risk level: unacceptable, high, limited, minimal
